body: Thats correct. I just tested Heron-with-zk without log4j-over-slf4j. It works without any issues.
True. Though zookeeper itself depends on slf4j so heron-with-zk depends also on slf4j.

These don't seem to abide by the java styles. Please build with `--experimental_action_listener=tools/java:compile_java` to verify.

Also we should change `heron/...` to `{heron,contrib}/...` in `scripts/build/travis/build.sh` to get build/test coverage as well as update `get_heron_java_paths` in `scripts/get_all_heron_paths.sh` to get IDEA integration.
:+1:  but you've got a travis failure

Oh my goodness, it seems like it's blowing up because I have a commit message with a `:`?
@maosongfu - can you take look at this?

Seems like the integration test is reading `/home/travis/.heron/heron-0.13.4-18-gb9c0fd2/client/release.yaml` which has the commit message included, which isn't valid yaml because of the ':'.

@kramasamy or @nlu90 do you know why the test would read `release.yml`? If that's in fact the intent, how is that file created? Commit messages would need to be quoted in that file.

@bmhatfield try wrapping the commit message in escaped quotes here:
https://github.com/twitter/heron/blob/master/scripts/release/status.sh#L62

```
echo "HERON_BUILD_COMMIT_MSG \"${commit_msg}\""
```

Sure. It seems relying on a pretty old version of heron master; @joestein could u rebase and fix with latest master branch? BTW, could u add me to your forked repo so I can checkout your code and review on my laptop? thanks

Approved. I was a little concerned about user input here, but it looks like it should work:

```
[bhatfield heron@master]% message='`echo oops`'
[bhatfield heron@master]% echo "THING \"${message}\""
THING "`echo oops`"
```

would be good to add `BUILD` files to build files under `heron/contrib`. This is necessary for #370.

Some errors are fixed. More errors arise because there is no `BUILD` file under `heron/contrib`. Some Java files cannot even be built. 

For example:

```
./../contrib/kafka/src/java/com/twitter/heron/storage/StormMetadataStore.java:30: 
error: class MetadataStore is public, should be declared in a file named 
MetadataStore.java
  2 public abstract class MetadataStore { 
                          ^^^^
```
We should add build files below contrib and get that building as well. See my comment in #638. Do you have a PR for the fixed errors?
Yes but the patch only fixes some errors. Running `javadocs.sh` still give me errors. I would like to wait #638 is closed, while I'll fix some more errors not caused by building.
do you want to make it use python cli?

What do you mean "make it use python cli"?
This pr rename ports' name from "port1, port2 ..." to more descriptive names.
I mean something like python argparse so that the order of names do not matter and it is more clear. Let us do that in the next PR.
üëç
üëç

PR #638 is a larger contribution that might take a while, so we probably don't want to block on it. It also adds a lot of new code. It would be best for us to get the existing contrib/ code building and clean before taking new submissions there. That would also help reduce the scope of PR #638 to only it's changes without a bunch of unrelated cleanup of pre-existing code.

Update on this ticket is that I've been chasing down a number of issues getting the build to work on mac, twitter CI and travis. I'm making progress and hopefully close, but around every corner I seem to git a snag. Fingers crossed...

No need to review my changes until I ask, since I'm still making updates.
üëç
üëç
@lucperkins @kramasamy Requesting for comments.

> Option 1: Add a config in client.yaml and this assumes that the class path is the same across different computers in the organization.
> 
> Option 2: Add a command line arg --extra-scheduler-classpath which augments the class path while submitting, activating, deactivating & killing a topology.
> 
> Current thinking is to provide option 1 and if needed provide option 2. Both the options could lead to conflicts. We can solve them when it occurs.

@kramasamy - Option 1 is fine. For submitting a yarn job, user adds yarn config files to the classpath too. Custom classpath is not limited to jar files only.
Fixed the java styles. I was using the bazel build --config=ubuntu scripts/packages:binpkgs. Does it enforce the style checks?

This is useful for Reef Scheduler also.
üëç

OK, I finally got the build/tests to pass on darwin, travis and twitter CI. This patch is ready to ship again.

@joestein I've go an interest in this and the kafka spouts, happy to take a look and run it through my test infra if I can get access to your repo.

@kramasamy omg, I'm not sure I want that title! :)

A few general issues. First, why was this doc added when [this doc](https://github.com/twitter/heron/blob/master/website/content/docs/operators/heron-ui.md) already exists? Is it intended to replace that doc or supplement it? If the latter, there needs to be links to that doc in this doc and a clarification of what each doc accomplishes. If the former, where is the actual _usage_ information for Heron UI? How do I deploy Heron UI? On which host and port does it run once it's deployed?

There's a lot of really great info here, but these things need to be clarified.

I can't see why that's happening. This is where the magic is supposed to happen:
https://github.com/twitter/heron/blob/master/tools/bazel.rc#L37

Did you try doing `bazel clean` first?

If that's not it could you try running the same target with `---experimental_action_listener=tools/java:compile_java`.

@lucperkins There are two parts to UI documentation. One is the `runbook` which lists how to deploy UI, and configurations. This is meant for the admins of UI, and it need not contain how the UI looks like. The second part is `usage`, which is more for topology developers, who want to use UI to get info about their topologies. They wouldn't want to know how to deploy the UI themselves.

This doc is the second one - usage. The one that you pointed to would be the runbook.

@billonahill addressed all the above comments. Can you check once more?
Thanks.

@lucperkins Yes, that will be my next PR. Wanted to make changes in modules. The next PR will remove redundant info from runbook page, and add info about some of the configs. I'll also add link in each doc to the other one.
Apart from minor nits, LGTM üëç
Will fix all comments
Fixed

Please don't commit python eggs. Instead use the `reqs` attribute to specify them in the pex targets. See #657 for an example.
per @kramasamy this is solved by using --user flag and original is correct.

Did bazel clean work?

The patch now passes the CI on travis and Twitter CI. It's almost all egg/whl removal with a few other buried changes:
- `tools/rules/pex_rules.bzl`
  The pex_test target wasn't getting the pypi location updated when running in twitter. It also needed `/bin` and `/usr/bin` in it's path for `chmod` and `exec`, used by the pycrypto build.
- `integration-test/src/python/test_runner/main.py`
  Unrelated, but I made changes to the test runner to show test times and improved log info
Fixed in #649
